messages.message:
Hi all, PNC have asked about OpenCV, and if we could incorporate calls to this before the OCR step. This brought up a few questions:
• Can we run a UDF before the ‘Process Files’ step?
• Has OpenCV been used internally before? 
• How would we deploy this? I believe its C (with Python Bindings). 
cc: @Bren
@Lee yes! OpenCV is supported!! Preprocessing scripts can be utilised before the OCR operation.. its python based!!
There is no need for an apply udf step, the process files itself takes a script input where this can be done
We do use OpenCV internally to enhance image quality..
Thanks @Hari. I’ll find out more about what the customer was intending to do with this library.
that's great! thanks @Hari. You dont happen to have a sample script we can use in the Process Files step that does something simple, do you? Just curious to see how to set it up

@Lee it’d be great to understand _why_ they want to use OpenCV before the OCR step. Customers often ask for things that they heard about but those things might not be useful for them to complete the use cases (or are not the best tools they can use with Instabase).
@Bren Sure!! @Shivam Can you pls share a simple example for image preprocessing?

I have below example where Process Files custom image filter is added.
https://instabase.com/apps/flow/edit/ib_solutions/solutions/fs/Instabase%20Drive/poc/SC/ImageFilter/workflows/demo.ibflow#
